bestBHT.bht: In this instance, Jesus had already communicated a task to be done in the past, using the word ειρηκε to indicate the past perfect action. The disciples followed His instructions and encountered a man carrying a water pitcher, guiding them to the designated house for the Passover. Once there, they informed the master of the house about Jesus' directives, who promptly showed them an appropriate room. They diligently prepared for the feast, ensuring everything was in order according to God's divine appointment.

Archibald T. Robertson: He had said (ειρηκε). Past perfect active indicative of ειπον where Mark 14:16 has ειπεν (second aorist).
John Gill: They met the man with the pitcher of water, and by following him, found the house Christ meant to keep the passover at."
They told the master of it, what Christ ordered them, who immediately showed them a very convenient room, as he had described to them.
Provided a lamb, and got it killed and dressed, and prepared every thing necessary for the keeping of the feast, according to divine appointment.

bhtAttempts.bht: In this verse, it is noted that Jesus had specifically mentioned a certain task to be done in the past. As the disciples followed His instructions, they encountered a man carrying a water pitcher and were led to the designated house for the Passover. There, they informed the master of the house about Jesus' instructions and were shown a suitable room. They made the necessary preparations to observe the feast according to God's commandments.
